DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Left Lymph Node Dissection Procedure Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of lymph node dissection procedure performed for Head and Neck cancer, specifically to the left side of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Left Lymph Node Dissection Surgical Procedure Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.._Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north._Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Head and Neck Left Lymph Node Dissection
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.:Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.:Surgical removal of lymph nodes.  Done to assess the spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgical removal of lymph nodes.  Done to assess the spread of cancer.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lymph Node Dissection Surgical Procedure Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Function; what something is used for.: (dye-SEK-shun) Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

Concepts.definition: The normal action performed by a structure or device.
Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which all the ipsilateral cervical lymph node groups of the neck, internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, spinal accessory nerve, and submandibular gland are removed.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which all the ipsilateral cervical lymph node groups of the neck, internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, spinal accessory nerve, and submandibular gland are removed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which all the ipsilateral cervical lymph node groups of the neck are removed but the internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and/or spinal accessory nerve are preserved.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which all the ipsilateral cervical lymph node groups of the neck are removed but the internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and/or spinal accessory nerve are preserved.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.
